sub_title: Research Associate | Start-up entrepreneur | PhD Networked Infrastructure Integration
summary:
+| I hold a PhD in Integrated Complex Urban Networks

+| I hold a Master of Science degree in International Project Management and Bachelor degree in Architectural Technology.

+| My vision is to work in international teams and projects that tackle high degree of innovation driven practices, developing high-level urban and regional visions and strategies for future design and use of space, while implementing cutting-edge architectural technology. 

+| My professional inspiration and drive is to always support international innovation projects at the highest level possible, and ensure implementation of innovative concepts in practical settings. 

About: I am very dynamic and curious person, continuously developing my skills to better facilitate creativity & cross-over connections in international projects, without endangering standard constraints (time, budget and quality). I believe, in their essence, international projects are the highest level of excellence in architectural and urban design. The strongest asset in an international project teams, is the diversity of the human capital.

I have experience in working with multinational teams in various international projects in different countries (The Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden,  Macedonia, United Kingdom and Russia). My professional experience ranges from involvement as: 

+ researcher of 'ambient city governance' (scientific and applied) 
+ urban and regional planning and design professional
+ architectural, construction and interior designer
+ creative curator (ISOCARP2015 Young Planning Professionals Programme coordinator, ISOCARP2015 Eindhoven workshop, various creative workshops with students and young professionals)

projects.title: Project Brief Proposal New Chalmers Interaction Building
projects.description: The client, Chalmers University of Technology, had the requirement to renew one sector of the University facilities which is currently underused and lacks architectural creativity and motivational environment. Among the demands was also the need to prepare the same building section for additional extension in volume to the adjoining lot due to the trend of increasing number of students. The project brief contains school work completed by a team of six, which executed series of analyses and proposal to deliver the client initial demands and wishes.

profile_positions.description:
+| UniverCities is an ICT based platform of ISOCARP Institute (https://isocarp.org/institute/) that services the Smart City vertical market. Our open source APIs work with Urban Data Platforms and assist municipalities to better use real-time urban data in town planning. The platform organizes data from smart devices and services in clusters, and combines it with scientific and expert knowledge insights. The service serves intelligent decision-making process in urban and regional planning policies, strategies and designs. 

+| As International Open Innovation 2.0 platform, it accelerates planning with cutting-edge technologies and brings intelligence in cities that apply (high) degree of digitized services. It uses a "digitized civil-centered" model of public participation, continuously including inhabitants as proactive partners in the urban and regional planning process.

+| Our strength is the unique capacity of the platform to support the paradigm shift in urban and regional planning by combining scientific and practice-based knowledge with local information (from big data). This enables the emergence of "new" planning policies, that serve real-time societal demand. 

+| UniverCities is an enabler that builds trust between inhabitants and governing institutions, by establishing supervised relationships in accessing and using personal data, and enables market for Smart City vendors.
profile_positions.title: Co Founder

profile_positions.description:
Project developer and manager for Smart Mobile Oirschot project.

Project brief:

Oirschot understands the great shift in society and transitioning from manufacturing led economy towards creative and data driven economy. Therefore, Oirschot is committed to prepare for supporting its inhabitants in this transition in the best possible way. 

The potentials of community-led development with the use of the latest technological and digital trends such as: big data analytics, artificial intelligence and cognitive computing, ubiquitous computing, ambient intelligence, crowd-sourced sensing, shared economy, industry 4.0, networked society etc, are in the core of Smart Mobile Oirshot. 

Oirschot (Kempen) as a demand-side stakeholder, understands the great potential of the Urban Platforms' market, as an opportunity for enabling local and regional economic growth. Therefore, with several parallel initiatives, Oirschot (Kempen) moves forward and addresses the challenges of the emerging, fragmented and uncertain market for City (Urban) Data. 

The municipality acknowledges that the next economy thrives on the power of big data. The City (Urban) Data, as a municipal asset, if properly facilitated, managed and communicated, can be used to empower inhabitants and boost local economy. By organizing and making City (Urban) Data and Data platforms more visible, local businesses can better understand market needs and address innovative new solutions and inhabitants can proactively contribute in surfacing the real needs.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Project Developer and Manager

profile_positions.title: Start-up entrepreneur | PhD

profile_positions.description:
I am one of the co founders of ConcepTI, architectural, interior concept and furniture design studio. 

In ConcepTI, we work with our clients in very personal, dedicated and close cooperation, always aiming to achieve their impression, bringing their dream living and working spaces to live, by unique and pleasant collaboration process. 

Our projects include conceptual and product design, of new or refurbishing of existing residential and office buildings, interior design and furniture design. 

Up to the smallest detail, we present our solutions via 3D models and final impressions.
profile_positions.title: Architect and Interior designer

profile_positions.company: ISOCARP - International Society of City and Regional Planners
profile_positions.description:
Initiating, promoting, managing and facilitating creative content of Eindhoven workshop themed "How to react when traditional industries move away: SOCIETY 2.0". 

Eindhoven workshop is part of 12 collaboration workshops joined under the umbrella congress theme "Cities Save the World! Let's re-invent Planning!"  and a central congress debate in Rotterdam.
More information about our Eindhoven workshop available at: 

http://www.isocarp2015.org/themes/eindhoven

and the congress and congress format here:

http://www.isocarp2015.org/
profile_positions.title: ISOCARP 2015 Congress Eindhoven workshop co-rapporteur

company.name: Moscow Multifunctional Center, Moscow City Department of Culture

profile_positions.company: Moscow Multifunctional Center, Moscow City Department of Culture
profile_positions.description:
Assisting the creative Urban Planner Ir. Cees Donkers, social urban planner in the municipality of Eindhoven, The Netherlands. My main responsibility was in assisting the curating of a creative workshop conducted with students and young professionals from ten different countries. 

The workshop bill was to program a creative and sustainable solution to activate one "in-between" space in Moscow suburbia. The location was the space underneath a very busy and noisy motorway, a part of the Moscow ring. The added value for the location involved designing for achieving better socially inclusive and interactive space, aiming for improving the quality of life and social cohesion for the local inhabitants.
profile_positions.title: Creative workshop assisting curator: III International Urban Forum "Cities for Youth"

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology

profile_positions.location: Faculty of Architecture and Engineering, Skopje, Macedonia
profile_positions.company: Board of European Students of Technology
profile_positions.description: A summary presentation for the BEST (Board of European Students of Technology) summer school organized by the Faculty of Architecture and Civil Engineering at Ss. Cyril and Methodius University in Skopje, Macedonia. The lecture included overview of the concept that defines the meaning of sustainability in architecture on single unite scale and sustainability on larger scale looking more specifically at neighborhood level, city level and regional level.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer at the summer school on the topic Sustainability in Urban Design and Architecture

profile_positions.description:
Currently, Eindhoven is the most innovative city in the world with nearly 3 times more patents per resident than the second most innovative place (Silicon Valley)! But how can future city design help to foster innovation in this modest city, in its leading companies and in its people? Cities such as Amsterdam, Paris, Barcelona, etc are considered great beautiful cities to travel to, work and live in. How can Eindhoven, not a classically attractive city, transform its urban form to be a place that future generations desire?

Through local trend research in conjunction with future societal forecasts we have established via a method of scenario thinking future potentials/urban interventions for the city of Eindhoven.
profile_positions.title: Stadslab European Urban Design Laboratory: Eindhoven 2050 Master Class and MA+U Design Studio.
